fields.name: description
fields.value: The purpose of life is often misunderstood. To create a life worthwhile, we need to prioritise happiness all day everyday. The purpose of life is to be happy!

fields.name: description
fields.value: Driving through the ups & downs, life can become a crazy ride. Let the journey at least be worthwhile. Create a path where you can drive with a purpose.

fields.name: description

fields.name: description

fields.name: description
fields.value:
While everyone talks about the benefits of Surya Namaskar in reducing that bulging belly but the truth is Surya Namaskar is far & beyond just mere physical benefits. 
Practicing Surya Namaskar can also help improve the functioning of your nervous system thereby making you mentally more fit & agile.

fields.name: description
fields.value: "Heal" while you sleep. A good snooze not only helps you feel good but helps you recover from emotional ailments.  So work on your sleep & rest will fall into place.

fields.name: description
fields.value: Taking a 10 minute break during work to renew yourself or taking time to take a warm shower while your hubby babysits isn't being selfish but it's a necessity. You must take care of yourself first so that you can care for others too.

fields.name: description
fields.value: Journalling is the first step towards tracking your patterns, eventually breaking the unhealthy ones & creating healthier ones. Not in the habit to pen things down, don't worry write or draw whatever you feel in a day in a journal or your notes in your device or just record what you feel as a voice note and revisit it later. The medium doesn't matter, the practice does.

fields.name: description
fields.value: Visiting a therapist is as basic as visiting a General Physician for a fever. If you can make the effort to see a doctor for a physical ailment then why not visit a therapist for an emotional problem? After all, the brain is a part of our body too!!!

fields.name: description
fields.value: Bhujangasana or Cobra Pose is a reclining back-bending asana in hatha yoga. Strengthens the spine. Stretches chest and lungs, shoulders, and abdomen. Tones the buttocks. Stimulates abdominal organs. Helps relieve stress and fatigue. Opens the heart and lungs. Soothes sciatica. Therapeutic for asthma.

fields.name: description
fields.value: You can become whatever you want with the power of affirmations. All you need is to train your brain to believe in your power to make things work and your brain will activate finding ways for you to make it all a reality.

fields.name: description
fields.value: Be grateful for all the good things that have come your way so far. Be grateful for every beautiful relationship, every morsel of the food we eat, every breath we take!! Being grateful will send positive messages to your nervous system thus attracting more positivity & positive experiences.

fields.name: description
fields.value: 💕 A love note to you 💕  You are enough despite all of the ways the world tries to convince you the otherwise.  You were enough every time someone made you feel small, unloved or not valued.  You are enough on your hard days and through your struggles.  You HAVE always been enough and perfect , exactly as you are and a reminder to let you know this valentine weekend that:  💕Your relationship status doesn’t define you or this week or month.  💕Cards, gifts and flowers are great but they don’t make you more or less wonderful.   💕Your are loved and entirely loveable just as you are.  💕You are not ‘too much’ or ‘to little’  💕You’re worth is not based on the opinions of others.  Feel the love within you. Appreciate who you are. Your body,your heart, your mind, your soul and everything about you  and know it is a gift. Surround yourself with others who see that. Step back from those who don’t.  Never apologise for your needs and beliefs. Keep your standard high and always know that you are whole and you don’t need anyone to complete you and this is the day/week/month to celebrate love in all its form. But most of all , celebrate you and always know that you are always enough💕  #friday #love #monthoflove

fields.name: description
fields.value: In 2005 Kevin Berthia went to the Golden Gate Bridge to end his life.  He ended up talking about his life with Officer Kevin Briggs for 92 minutes while he was on the edge of the bridge.  10 years later they meet on the same bridge in much better circumstances.  Good words and good people can change everything.❤️  Today, I want you to know that words filled with love  are much more powerful and influential than any weapon and that the words filled with love have long standing effects on the  minds of a listener .   Words have magical power. They can bring either bring the greatest happiness or deepest despair . So the need of the hour is, to think before we speak anything,as words are sharper than the two edged sword. Let’s make a point to use our words to lift the spirit of the people and to be the kind of person who can bring smiles in one’s face because at moment the world needs such people.   Are you willing today to use your words to lift someone up instead of knocking them down?  #depression #anxiety #mentalhealth #mentalillnessisreal #mentalhealthawareness  #sad #pain #trauma #ptsd #mentalillness  #depressed #suicide #stress #recovery #therapy #mentalhealthmatters #life #healing  #pain #trauma #depressionhelp #mindfulness #kindwords #spoken #inlove  #savelives #therapist #india #karnataka #mangalore #joychristin

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Suffering from Anxiety can be an isolating experience but a few techniques can truly help you shrug off that anxiety that's becoming a road bump between you & your growth. 
So simple whenever feeling anxious just take your mind away from the situation & concentrate on your breath. 
Breathe in & out 10 times focussing on nothing else but your breath while you create this infinity sign on a piece of paper. Trust us this simple technique can do wonders. 
Try it & share your experience with us in the comment section below.

fields.value: If your child begins to be moody and angry, sad or distant, please pay attention. Complaints of feeling tired, sore stomach, headache, disinterested; many of these are part of the tween/teen stage of development, but many are also indicators of stress, anxiety and depression, possibly preludes to suicidal thoughts.  Know that talking about  mental health to our childen IS helpful, and often they will respond positively to us. Listed below are few pointers that as parents we can keep in our mind to help our children.   #childtherapy #childmentalhealth #kidsmentalhealth #postfortheday

fields.name: description
fields.value:
We always stay alert to communicate well with our peer groups, relatives, friends, and our seniors, so much so that, we completely forget to communicate with ourselves in a more productive way to keep ourselves motivated, inspired, and positive.

We often fall into the trap of self-doubt and that is where positive self-talk comes as a rescue to make us feel empowered and energized in any given situation.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
We all have role models in our life. We aspire to become like them. It's an art to choose your role model in the correct way because just the way your shadow follows you, you follow your chosen role model and in a way, their achievements and actions become your reflection. 

Choose a role model who is always moving to achieve something bigger in life despite being surrounded by mediocrity so that you are also in movement, taking action for your achievements and accomplishments.  

Share your opinions in the comments section.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Trapped for hours in the world of social media? You might want to check on the signs of Social Media Addiction. 
Addictive social media is quite similar to substance abuse, it can cause mood swings depending on things or reactions you get on social media extremely frequently, constant preoccupation with social media, over usage of the platforms, and also withdrawal symptoms when not using it. 
Next time you see someone with these signs, help them get over this addiction, it is treatable.

fields.value:
Have you designed any system yet?

We all spend so much of our time thinking about the goals that we wish to achieve in our lifetime. We dream about achieving the best things in our life so much so that we start to vision ourselves with that goal or objective in hand.

Merely thinking about achieving the goals can bring a small smile to our face while we only imagine achieving them, but if we want fulfilment in our life then we need to plan out a system to achieve the desired objective of our life. 

A system is a plan of action that is designed to achieve the goal and it works a route to success while we make sure then we strictly take actions as per the plan of action.

#themotivationalbeat #lifetransformationcoach #lifecoach #purposecoach #nlp #success #growth #mindset #mindsetreset #goals #planofaction

fields.value:
“Criticism ignites shame, and shame is corrosive. It erodes trust. It undermines confidence. It devours energy. It steals happiness. It internalizes pain. Shaming children may or may not be effective in correcting behavior in the short-term, but it has potentially devastating lifelong consequences. Guard your children’s hearts fiercely, my friends. Handle them tenderly. Guide them gently. Accept them freely. Love them unconditionally. The adults
 they become will thank you for it, and this world will be a far better place with more heart-whole humans instead of more refugees from childhood.” 
L.R.Knost #kids #emotionalwellness #qotd

When you exercise or indulge in a mindful Yoga session, the muscles in your body feel firm and strong. Likewise, when your facial muscles are put to use with face yoga, they feel toned and give the sensation of a natural face lift, if practiced regularly.

Overall, your face, head and neck has 57 muscles that need exercise, just like your legs, arms, and core. Have you ever thought about that? 

Exercising your face daily will result in much firmer and smoother skin.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
How well do you push yourself?



There would be circumstances against you while you wish to achieve something big in your life. There would be people who would give you countless reasons to give up in between. There would be people who would always discourage you. 


Despite having all the hardships in your life. You need to find out ways to keep moving towards your dreams. You must find out avenues to keep chasing your goals while you still keep yourself away from all the toxicity around you.



So push yourself every day a little more. Push yourself towards your dreams, push yourself away from the people who always discourage you and push yourself out of your comfort zone, because no one else is going to do it for you. 



Be an enabler to rise above your set limits.

#themotivationalbeat #swatijain #lifelifetransformationcoach #empowermentcoach #nlp #purposecoach #success #pushyourself #toxicity #mindset #mindsetreset

Standing up straight, sitting comfortably, and appearing confident are all benefits of great posture. Balancing the body, strengthening what needs to become stronger and loosening up areas of the body that hold onto tension, improves your body's functionality and comfort tremendously.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
There are three unique kinds of tears: reflex, nonstop, and enthusiastic tears.

Reflex tears clear garbage, similar to smoke and residue, from your eyes. Nonstop tears grease up your eyes and assist with safeguarding them from contamination. Enthusiastic tears might have numerous medical advantages. While ceaseless tears contain 98% water, enthusiastic tears contain pressure chemicals and poisons. Scientists have conjectured that crying flushes these things out of your framework, however more examination is required around here.

Crying might be probably your best instrument to self-mitigate. Scientists have observed that crying actuates the parasympathetic sensory system (PNS). The PNS helps your body rest and overview. The advantages aren't quick, in any case. It might require a few minutes of crying tears before you feel the mitigating impacts of crying.

Sobbing for significant stretches discharges oxytocin and endogenous narcotics, also called endorphins. These vibe great synthetics can assist with facilitating both physical and enthusiastic agony. When the endorphins are delivered, your body might go into an all around numb stage. Oxytocin can provide you with a feeling of quiet or prosperity. It's one more illustration of how crying is a self-calming activity.

Alongside assisting you with facilitating torment, crying, explicitly wailing, may even give you a much needed boost. Whenever you wail, you take in numerous speedy breaths of cool air. Taking in cooler air can help control and even lower the temperature of your cerebrum. A cool cerebrum is more pleasurable to your body and psyche than a warm mind. Subsequently, your state of mind might work on after a crying episode.

In the event that you're feeling blue, crying is a method for telling everyone around you want support; this is known as a relational advantage. Since you were a child, crying has been a connection conduct. Its capacity is in numerous ways to get solace and care from others. As such, it assists with developing your social encouraging group of people whenever hard times arise.

Lamenting is a cycle. It includes times of distress, deadness, responsibility, and outrage. Crying is especially significant during times of lamenting. It might even assistance you process and acknowledge the passing of a friend or family member. Everybody goes through the lamenting system in various ways. Assuming you observe that your crying is outrageous or beginning to impede your daily existence, it very well may be smart to check in with your primary care physician.

Crying doesn't just occur because of something miserable. Here and there you might cry when very blissful, terrified, or focused. Scientists at Yale University honestly think that crying in this manner might assist with reestablishing enthusiastic balance. At the point when you're inconceivably blissful or frightened about something and cry, it could be your body's method for recuperating from encountering such a compelling inclination.

𝙎𝙝𝙮𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙖 𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙗𝙡𝙚𝙢. 𝙄𝙩'𝙨 𝙟𝙪𝙨𝙩 𝙖 𝙗𝙚𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙞𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙡 𝙥𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙣 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙; 𝙖𝙣 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙞𝙧 𝙙𝙞𝙨𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙘𝙚𝙧𝙩𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙨𝙞𝙩𝙪𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨."

Whatever the situation may be, what usually helps is to UNDERSTAND your child and ACCEPT their feeling ❤

🙈 With a shy child, it always helps to talk and prepare them in advance for new situations, like a guest coming over, visit to someone's house, or exposing the child to new people and places for the first time. 

Let the child know in advance about any of these situations ☝ and set expectations right. Shy kids generally fret when caught by surprise. 

🙈 Allow the child to express what they're feeling - fear, shyness, or discomfort. More than the child behaving "the correct way" before others, it's even more important for them to "express" what they feel inside them. 

🙈 It helps to teach a child to be polite to all despite feeling nervous. For instance, you could say, "All you need to do is come outside and say hello and then you need not stay longer, if you don't feel comfortable to."

🙈 Make sure to appreciate and praise your child's small efforts each time when alone. Praise reinforces positive behavior in future 👍❤


#shykids #childbehavior #childpsychology #parentingtips

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Why do kids get irritated? 

For the same reason that we adults feel irritable at times - When something doesn't go the way we'd want it to or when we can't get what we wished for. 

Now picture the same scenario with a child wanting something real bad and not able to get it. To make matters worse, she can't even articulate her needs in the best way understandable. Hence, the irritable behavior.

When your child gets irritated and enters into tantrum-throwing mode👇 

✅ Remind yourself that your child needs help. They want something, want to say something, but aren't able to express themselves the right way. This reminder will help you stay calm in the situation ❤️ 

✅ Instead of trying to "fix" the situation right away by either reacting harshly or giving punishment, try understand the "real reason" for their irritability. Remember that there always is a reason behind child behavior 👍 

If you aren't able to understand the reason (it's okay, very often we can't always do), these phrases can help 👇 

👉 "I can see that you're irritated over something. Would you like to tell me about it or talk about it?" 

👉 "It's okay to feel irritable sometimes. We all do. Stay with the feeling for a bit and I'll be here if you need me for anything." 

Responding rather than reacting to the situation will help you keep your cool and also avoid any likely conflict with the child. ❤️ 

REMEMBER 👉 Kids need time to understand and cope with "Big Emotions". Until then, they mostly act on impulse. Giving them that time and space is what usually helps parents 🙂

#parenting #irritabilityinkids #childbehavioralissues

𝙒𝙝𝙚𝙣 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙧𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙖𝙡𝙠 𝙩𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 '𝙜𝙤𝙤𝙙 𝙩𝙤𝙪𝙘𝙝' 𝙖𝙣𝙙 '𝙗𝙖𝙙 𝙩𝙤𝙪𝙘𝙝?'

While doctors and child experts suggest the earlier the better (usually around preschool age), most parents find the "talk" difficult to carry out with their kids. 

🛑 They feel the child is too young

🛑 They think that such experiences are unlikely to happen with their own kids and perhaps when they do, the discussion can be brought up

🛑 It's uncomfortable to discuss this with a child 

Yes, the talk can be uncomfortable; nonetheless, it's one of the most important you'll be having with your child. 

𝙄𝙙𝙚𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮, 𝙗𝙚𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙠𝙞𝙙 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙨 𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 (𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙚𝙧𝙨), 𝙞𝙩'𝙨 𝙖𝙡𝙬𝙖𝙮𝙨 𝙖 𝙜𝙤𝙤𝙙 𝙞𝙙𝙚𝙖 𝙩𝙤 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙢 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙖𝙥𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙥𝙧𝙞𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙩𝙤𝙪𝙘𝙝. 

The process starts much earlier on though and here's how you can begin 👇

👉 Let kids know that they "own" their body and they're like the "boss" of their own bodies. Nobody, not even a family member, can try steal that ownership from them. 

👉 Make sure that the child isn't touched against his/her approval. While it's important to encourage the child's social skills/network, it's equally imperative to make sure as a parent that kids are not "forced" upon anything (hugging/kissing/touching) if they don't like so. 

👉 Always teach the child the actual names of their private parts. Avoid using baby names for these before the child. When they grow up learning what these parts are called as well as their function, they're more likely to understand things in a better perspective. 

👉 When explaining to the child, always keep the tone of the conversation right. Avoid yelling or getting restless when the child throws an unexpected question. Explain in a way that's easy for the child to understand and doesn't scare them off. 

👉 If you feel that the child isn't ready to process or understand this information, try at another time a little later. Don't give up completely. Keep having the talk with your child in diff ways. 

#goodtouchbadtouch #teachingpreschoolers #parentingtips

𝙒𝙝𝙮 𝙞𝙩 𝙞𝙨𝙣'𝙩 𝙖 𝙜𝙤𝙤𝙙 𝙞𝙙𝙚𝙖 𝙩𝙤 𝙡𝙚𝙩 𝙖 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙙𝙡𝙚𝙧/𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙜 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙 𝙘𝙧𝙮 𝙩𝙤 𝙨𝙡𝙚𝙚𝙥 - 𝘼 𝙥𝙨𝙮𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙡𝙤𝙜𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙡 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚

We often refuse to give in to the demands (sometimes unreasonable) of our little kids. 

The next thing we know they either walk away in anger or start crying (actually howling) at the top of their voice! 🤦‍♀️

And sometimes, this scene continues until they get tired of it and eventually fall asleep (well, more like cry themselves to sleep)

However relieving it might sound (with the howls finally over), psychologists say that it isn't really a good idea to let the child cry itself to sleep. Why? 

👉 We may not always realise it but not responding to a crying child in the appropriate way makes the latter feel a deep sense of neglect on the part of parent. 

👉 This feeling can sometimes stay with the child in their mind much longer than expected (even into adulthood). 

👉 Repeated occurence of such episodes (wherein the parent feels that it's okay to let the child cry by way of punishing them or teaching them a lesson) may even slowly emotionally distance the child from one parent or both. 

So what's the best way to handle a crying child then? 🤔

👍 Always respond to a crying child (how much ever you're feeling angry yourself). 

👍 Take a minute to calm down and begin by asking them what is it that's really bothering them (you'd be surprised that more often than not it's the simple things like hunger and sleep that are the real cause behind them creating a scene!) 

👍Make an effort to understand the child more than trying to make them understand. Kids are more likely to cooperate with you when they feel understood. 

👍 Comfort them with a warm hug and sweet kiss - that's all they want from you sometimes 🥰

#childbehavior #childpsychology #understandingkidsbehavior #parenting

fields.name: description
fields.value:
I know it's hard. Being fully present with your child when there's so much going on in your mind and around you as well.

Household chores, job/business, health, self-care ...the list is endless.

And this isn't just one day; it's literally the story of your life. Each day. Every day.

How easy is it then to be there with your child fully? Isn't it easy to finish up tasks or do what we love when they're distracted in play/watching TV?

Yes, it absolutely is! But here's a FUN FACT! ☺️

When you're fully present with your child - not just physically but emotionally - you're investing every minute of your time into building a loving future with your kids 💕 And you, my friend, can hope to reap the sweet returns of every minute spent today 30 years from now!

❤ Spend a little extra time with your kids. Don't just SIT with them. Get INVOLVED in what they're doing.

❤ Spend 10 minutes watching their favorite cartoon/TV show with them.

❤ When they sit to do their homework, don't just sit there to supervise whether or not they're studying. Ask questions (turn them into fun riddles even to invoke interest), role play with them being the teacher, hold their hand and guide them gently if they can't.

The more involved you get, the more likely kids are to perform better in whatever they do.

So let's try being FULLY present with our kids. We only have lots to earn in the process 🙂❤

#raisingkidsright
#parenting
#parentingtips

Stress is contagious. It inevitably passes on from us to our kids. All those tantrums, back-answers, and yells are usually a result of our own behavior and presence before our kids. 

We react to their behavior - almost spontaneously, without another thought, and there it starts - an argument that erupts into a fight in no time. 

You're not wrong in reacting because you're a victim of your stress. We all are. I hear you. This is why I follow this one simple tip 👇

fields.name: title
fields.value:
Yoga Made Everything Better For Me..

🤪1. My fitness journey began with the intention to shed the extra kilos.. 
The struggle was not just physical..but mentally it began to become "unachievable".. I was losing it for not losing it.

Until I tried yoga. It definitely calmed me down on a mental level 1st! I began to feel good about everything, everyone & myself.. I automatically stopped looking at weight loss as my goal. I began to understand & dived deeper into the study of yoga & life. It turned out that I could do anything if I loved and respected myself enough! I did just that. 💜🧿

I value my mental health over my physical health!
👉2. Yoga made all other forms of workout easier & more rewarding for my body. Be it low intensity, high intensity or weight training.. it gets better for anyone who practices yoga... Also, mostly every form of exercise can be performed within a well planned yoga flow

🤝3. Another fun fact: My husband's game of golf got better as he began to practice yoga! @kmc1510 Can you believe it! 

4. If anyone makes you feel yoga is boring.. it's time to explore😜

#yogamakesmehappy #yogamakesyoustrong #mentalhealth #fitness #yogaisnotboring #yogaisforeverybody #anyonecan #youareenough #yogatraining #workin #inwardsjourney #journey #selflove #funfacts #makinglifebetter #yogaismagic #yoginilife #iloveme #iloveyoga #nothingisunachievable #yocan #justdoit #loveyourself

fields.name: description
fields.value:
We are moms. We all have our days. When we yell at our kids.

When we're harsh on them. When we completely lose our cool.

It happens to the best of us. So many times.

On days like these, remember not to be hard on yourself. Remember not to beat yourself up over it. Remind yourself it's okay.

"It's okay if I yelled at them. It's okay if I was a bit harsh. It's okay if I lost my cool because ...well, I'm human. I'm not perfect. And, I don't want to be either."

Remind yourself - my kids don't need a perfect mom. All they need and would ever appreciate is if I can be mindful of what just happened. If I have the awareness that what just happened wasn't exactly the most appropriate or the best way to handle the situation, that's good enough!

I got this. I'm gonna go and talk to my kids now. I'm gonna sit with them calmly and explain to them that I did not appreciate their behavior. And yes, I'm definitely going to let them know what they should be doing in future so that such situations (yelling and chaos) can be avoided as far as possible.

Yes, now that's a wonderful idea! 

I have the freedom to feel and express my spontaneous emotions the way I do but then I have the power to fix things, to correct what I did wrong, to set right the chaos that I ended up creating. Ahhh!

Now that's called mindfulness. And as long as I'm equipped with this skill, I have nothing to worry about :)

#mindfulparenting

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Feel your feelings, and let your children feel theirs. After all, the only way past them is through them. 

Some of us as children were not allowed to express our emotions, so that might be easier said than done. We were told to “get over it,” “suck it up,” that “you’re ok,” or worse. Over time we may have learned to avoid our feelings. And now that we’re parents, witnessing or hearing our own children in distress might be uncomfortable and we may just want to make it stop.

But here’s the thing: Emotions are involuntary; they’re not under our conscious control. Suppressing them, or telling our children to suppress theirs, doesn’t make them magically disappear. Sure, sitting with feelings can be overwhelming and maybe even painful. But denying them is akin to denying who we are in any given moment. And denying our children’s feelings sends the message that we don’t accept who they are in that moment; that we accept them only when they’re happy or agreeable. Consequently they may begin to believe their feelings aren’t valid or worthy, and that they shouldn’t trust their emotions. They may even start to avoid them. 

Avoiding emotions has been linked to anxiety, depression, & even physical distress. 

Conversely, acknowledging emotions, experiencing them, and moving through them promotes mental & physical well-being. And when we validate our children’s feelings, we promote a deeper connection between us via our understanding & acceptance of them. 



#may #mentalhealth #awarenessmonth #emotions #feel #your #feelings #parentingreminder #mentalhealthtip #reminder #selfreminder #parentingtips #kids #teens #youngadult  #positiveparenting #brainhealth #brainfitness #gentleparenting  #parenting  #resilience #respectfulparenting #psychologist  #childdevelopment  #mentalhealth #consciousparenting #india #karnataka #mangalore #childpsychologist #joychristin #postoftheday📷

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Kids throwing tantrums, crying and yelling, throwing stuff around, making a mess, not listening to the mom ... the complaints are endless.

Here's the thing - 

Those tantrums will continue. The crying and yelling is not going anywhere. They'll always make a mess and even refuse to listen because ... well, kids will be kids!

This is the one truth that won't change. It's difficult to control things now when they're young or even try changing them, but it's easier to fall into the trap - get flustered, agitated, and stressed out. Yes, it's much easier to feel ALL of this.

But here's another thing, my friend! Parenting can get SO much easier when you learn this ONE basic truth - kids won't change but you can. You may not be able to control their behavior completely today but you can definitely control the way you feel about it. You can, my friend, move from reacting to responding :)

But how do you react less and respond to their tantrums the appropriate way so they start to co-operate with you more? 

Work on your mind. Relax. Calm down. Take time out for yourself, even if it's just 10 minutes in a day but your exclusive ME TIME! Smile more. Laugh loud. When you're calmer from within, you'd get less flustered every single time those little monsters are up to something!!

Do share your views on this! Would love to hear what you think...

#parenting #stressfreeparenting

fields.name: description
fields.value:
I as a Parent Coach have said this so so many times, "connect with your child, before you correct your child". So many of you ask, 

➡️Don't you ever correct your child?
➡️Don't you ever shout at her?➡️How can you let your child do whatever she wants do?
➡️Don't you get irritated sometimes?
➡️Don't tell me she never throws tantrums in public..

So today I want to tell all of you The Truth....

Before a Parent Coach, I am a Mother and before that also I am a Daughter, who has been raised by a typical Indian Parents. These concepts of Conscious Parenting, Gentle Parenting are new for all of us. We as a generation are trying the break the chain of Carrot & Stick method of Parenting and developing new standards of Parenting for the next generation...

So yes I admit today

▶️Sometimes I correct my child when I am not conscious about my behavior
▶️Sometimes I shout at my daughter when I am unable to control my anger
▶️I let her do whatever she wants as I want to make her realise that her choices matter, and she should know she has the right to take her own decisions
▶️Yes I get irritated sometimes because I am still learning to regulate my emotions
▶️Yes she throws tantrums in public, but she knows that her mom loves her no matter what and helps her to overcome that wave of emotions...
 
Here it is, it is not always that Merry as it is seen on social media. We have our own ups and downs, because at the end of the day I am a Human Being and I tend to make mistakes but with that I accept my mistakes, apologize for them and move ahead....

Lets discuss in the comments, how you connect with your little one⏬

fields.name: description
fields.value:
#mindfulnessinparenting

How much do we praise our child, for his/her efforts, for his/her behavior, for his/her love, how much??

Rarely we appreciate them whenever they are doing something right or behaving themselves or doing with focus and dedication. But the moment they do something which they shouldn't be doing, our pitch raises to its full volume that even the neighbors can make out that something has happened...

You know why this happens, because kids are experimenting with their surroundings and when they were behaving properply, that didn't get your attention towards them. The thing that got their attention registers in their mind and from now on the child continues to display that behavior to seek you attention everytime....

Now what we can do to stop them from displaying that negative behavior,  we start praising their positive behavior. We start appreciating them fro their efforts, hard work, love, positive behavior. It will encourage them to show more of that behavior which grabs your attention.

Make sure you keep these points in mind

➡️Be Specific when praising
➡️Praise the efforts/progress not only results
➡️Praise & Correction shall be at separate time 
➡️Praise must be genuine & sincere
➡️Praise in Public – Correct in Private
➡️Accentuate the positive

So this is the Art of Praising, which can help you inculcate and accentuate the positive behavior in your kids....

Lets discuss in the comments, for what you appreciated you child today and how?? ⏬⏬

How does it help our face 
Why shd we do massages

Can a person who have already undergone fillers do face yoga
When we can start earliest by what age

When I created this method, I wanted everybody to have complete control over their faces, bodies, and wellbeing. Those who do these techniques with me  have a toolbox of techniques they can apply every single day. The results vary from person to person

It’s a routine anyone can implement. Whether you have 50 minutes or only two minutes a day, daily face yoga practice will give you glowing skin at any age. 

Overall, your face, head and neck has 57 muscles that need exercise, just like your legs, arms, and core. Have you ever thought about that? 

Exercising your face daily will result in much firmer and smoother skin. 

FACE MASSAGE
Face massaging is key for glowing skin. 

That’s because it boosts circulation, improves lymphatic drainage, and removes tension. It turns all of the attention to your face for a relaxing and powerful experience. 

 FACE RELAXATION
This part is so important. We’re used to frowning and tensing up our face muscles so often, we don’t even notice anymore. This may cause expression lines on the forehead, under the eyes, and other areas. 

Face relaxation works by reverting that. Not only does it prevent stress-related wrinkles, but it relaxes your face muscles for comfort and wellbeing. 

WELLBEING 
You can’t expect your skin to be vibrant and healthy when the rest of your body is out of balance. 
Yoga Method encourages balanced nutrition, good quality sleep, mindfulness, skincare, self-care, breathing techniques, and positive affirmations. This will take care of your body and soul, and of course, it’ll show on your skin.

Jon Kabat-Zinn, founder of Mindfulness based Stress Reduction defined mindfulness as paying attention, on purpose, in the present moment non-judgementally, sometimes, as if your life depended on it.
Here, is an invitation to just take a moment to draw your attention perhaps to one thing that is having contact with your body. It may be the floor beneath you, the wall against your back or the support of the surface you are sitting on. Simply taking a moment and drawing your attention to this contact, allowing your mind and thoughts to flow back to your attention to this contact. The simple act of paying attention has done it! Even to any other thoughts that came in. You did it! You just successfully practiced mindfulness!

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Which is the most difficult pase of childhood?? 

Adolescence 

You know when your kids are all grown up, they are exploring the world on their own, making new friends, hitting puberty and gushing emotions and hormones which can very much create an imbalance... 

We can generally come to a conclusion that kids are doing this on purpose...
But the fact is that they are still trying to find the difference between right and wrong. 

At this point of time Parenting plays a very important role as you can help them find a clear and broader perspective to a situation and not by forcing them to follow your perspective blindly... 

Here are 5 secrets that can be really helpful for communicating with kids through the difficult adolescent years 

1. Start With Understanding, Even When You Don’t Understand
A very simple secret to a Parent-Adolescent relationship is to start talking to your kid with Understanding. Your child is trying to balance everything and sometimes might give importance to something that you might think is useless, but even if it doesn't make sense to you, keep yourself in your child's shoes first before telling what needs to change. 

2. Don’t Get Emotional Or Take It Personally
Keep emotions out of the conversation.  You may not like how he's behaving or whatever he is saying or thinking, but keep emotions out of it. Your child may be making a poor choice, but the truth is, he might not yet have the skill set to make a better one. So your job is to help guide him to better choices so he can, in turn, develop better problem-solving skills. 

3. Ask Honest Questions…Not Loaded Questions
When you start asking questions that are attacking, your teen will definitely go into a defensive mode. Don’t ask loaded questions that just leads to conflict and not solutions. Let your teen know that his problems are his to solve. Give him the opportunity—yes, opportunity—to solve his own problems. But, do let him know that he can come to you for support. 

4. Don’t “Need” Your Child’s Good Behavior
When you need something and don’t get it, you will naturally try harder by controlling and manipulating more. And your teen will become more and more defiant or passively compliant—neither of which is good. When you’re not trying to control him and you’re not reacting to him, he will have to wrestle with himself rather than with you. 

5. Don’t Do Anything Until You’re Both Calm
We have talked about it so many times and this can be applied in any age. You cannot talk till the time you are yourself calm. When emotions have evened out, you can sit down and talk with him. It’s never good to try to bring up a difficult subject or resolve a conflict in the heat of the moment. So if either you or your child is upset, pause and come back when you can address things in a calmer way. 

So I hope this helps you to be in a better relationship with your teenager. 
Remember: this is just a phase of life, where brain is hijacked by hormones. It will pass.... 

Share your thoughts in the 'comment'

@circleoflife_beginning_to_end 

#consciousparenting #teenageparenting

fields.value:
We all want to raise responsible children. And we all want to live in a world where others have been raised to be responsible, a world where adults don’t shrug off their responsibilities as citizens.

You begin by seeing responsibility as something joyful for your child, instead of a burden. All children want to see themselves as response-able -- powerful and able to respond to what needs to be done. They need this for their self esteem, and for their lives to have meaning. Children don't want just to be doted on. They need, like the rest of us, to feel like they matter to the world, like their lives make a positive contribution.

So, you don't really need to teach kids to handle themselves responsibly in the world; you just need to teach them that they have the power to contribute positively, and to relate to them so that they want to do so. 

The bottom line is that kids will be responsible to the degree that we support them to be.

Will you raise a responsible child? If yes, how? Let me know in comments below

fields.name: description
fields.value:
The truth is that failure is never the end of the road. It is simply an indicator that there are some parts of ourselves and our lives that we need to put more effort into in order to get the results that we desire.

It’s important to acknowledge failure in your life when it happens. This will help you to identify what it is you need to focus on, so that you can approach the situation in a new way for success in the future.

Failure shouldn’t be the end of your dreams, goals, and aspirations. The power of failure should motivate you to chase your goals, take a fresh start and make a new beginning. Let failure make you stronger, tougher and more resilient so that you don’t just survive it but you’ll bounce back stronger.

If you are struggling to cope with challenges, don't be afraid to talk to your healthcare provider or a mental health professional. Even resilient people need help and part of being resilient is knowing when to ask for support and assistance

fields.value:
THE PSYCHOLOGY OF PERSUASION

Knowing how to persuade someone into doing something is an important skill to get things done. Today, we’ll explore the psychology of persuasion. We’ll learn about some of the key factors that determine how effective our persuasion attempts are, and what we can do to improve our own persuasion skills. Whether you’re trying to convince your boss to give you a raise or trying to get your significant other to see things your way, understanding how persuasion works can help you achieve your objectives.

Psychology of persuasion: what it is and how it works

The psychology of persuasion is the study of how people can be influenced to change their opinions or behavior. It is a branch of social psychology that investigates the psychological factors influencing people’s decisions and actions.

Persuasion begins with a message that is conveyed through a channel to a receiver. The message may be verbal or nonverbal, and the receiver may be aware or unaware that the message is intended to persuade them to do something.

Different methods of persuasion and their effectiveness

There are many methods of persuasion, and their effectiveness depends on the situation involved. These can be divided into three main categories:

Emotional

Logical

Social.

Emotional persuasion relies on appealing to the emotions of the audience. This can be done by invoking fear, guilt, or even love. For example, a commercial might use fear to persuade someone to buy a product, by showing them what could happen if they don’t. Guilt can also be used as an effective tactic.

Logical persuasion is to persuade based on reasoning and evidence. It is a strategy where the argument is made based on laying down facts and let the audience reach a conclusion.

Social persuasion is when our thoughts and actions are intentionally influenced by other people. It involves reciprocity. We tend to do a favor for someone who has done something for us.

The power of persuasion in sales, marketing and advertising

Salespersons use persuasion techniques every day to convince people to buy their products. By understanding how persuasion works, you can use these techniques to your advantage in your personal and professional life, and not just for boosting sales of a product/service.

Advertising and marketing are two industries that have long relied on the power of persuasion to drive results. After all, what is advertising if not an attempt to persuade someone to buy a product or service? And what is marketing if not an attempt to persuade someone to buy into a brand?

The power of persuasion is no secret. In fact, it is one of the most commonly used tactics in both advertising and marketing, often in very subtle ways.

The dark side of persuasion: how it can be used to manipulate and control others

Persuasion is a form of influence where you convince someone to think or behave in a certain way. Thus, it can be used for either good or evil purposes. When used with a good intent, it can help people make positive changes in their lives. When used in an evil manner, it can be used to manipulate and control others.

The dark side of persuasion involves influencing people to do things that are harmful to themselves.

How to resist persuasion and think for yourself

Most of us are susceptible to persuasion without even realizing it. We may be influenced by a friend, family member, or even a stranger without meaning to be. However, there are ways to resist persuasion and think for yourself.

Here are a few handy tips to resist persuasion:

Be aware of your own biases.

We all have conscious or subconscious biases, which make us more likely to be persuaded by someone.

Be alert.

We can spot persuasion attempts and try to resist them.

Counter-argue

Debating over why their persuasion is wrong and strongly holding onto your beliefs.

Coach Naazneen 
( Counselor and Energy Healer)

POSITIVE AFFIRMATIONS 

Research studies have shown that people today are experiencing higher rates of depression. Oftentimes, this can include low self-esteem and loss of motivation. Negative and distorted thought patterns may contribute to or worsen these symptoms. Positive affirmation can be used for kids, teens, and even adults to encourage and create a positive mindset. Affirmations are small phrases or sentences we tell ourselves to help motivate, empower, or change negative or distorted thoughts. That is, the notion that changing our thoughts can lead to changes in our behaviors.

WHY AFFIRMATION ARE POWERFUL 
Affirmations have the power to change how we feel and how we act. By introducing  positive affirmations in our daily life we can promote positive thought patterns.
Thus, prepare ourselves  for success in life: mentally, emotionally, and socially. 

HOW TO USE AFFIRMATION EFFECTIVELY

 Many people may recite positive affirmations to themselves out loud or in their head. They may choose a certain time of day to practice this or do it sporadically throughout the day.

Others may write their affirmations down, such as in a journal or may stick them on a mirror or place where they will be reminded to use them frequently.

Choosing a quiet time and place to practice self-affirmations is also a great way to practice mindfulness.

fields.value:
*Men’s mental health has been neglected*

Historically,  men’s mental health has been neglected and even ignored in favor of telling men and boys to “just be strong and manly.” Although the internet has started bringing more attention to this epidemic, there’s still so much stigma around men expressing their emotions. The truth is, it isn’t healthy, mentally or physically, to push down those emotions for an indefinite amount of time.

Reading Quotes May Help You Feel Less Alone
While just reading some statements may seem like an insignificant action, seeing a famous or influential man who is able to be vulnerable and in touch with his emotions may inspire self-reflection and a feeling of community. It can be so easy to feel alone in how you feel, but you may be surprised to hear that so many celebrities (and even just people in your neighborhood) are experiencing similar feelings and struggles.

Quotes About What Mental Illness Feels Like
Though reading somewhat sad quotes about depression or mental illness when experiencing a low may feel counterintuitive, it can be surprisingly validating when others can put words to your feelings.

The following quotes focus on what depression and general mental struggles feel like on a personal level.

“Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear. The frequent attempt to conceal mental pain increases the burden: It is easier to say ‘My tooth is aching’ than to say ‘My heart is broken.’” -C.S. Lewis

“Every act of life, from the morning toothbrush to the friends at dinner, became an effort. I hated the night when I couldn’t sleep, and I hated the day because it went toward night.” -F. Scott Fitzgerald

“People who have never dealt with depression think it’s just being sad or being in a bad mood. That’s not what depression is for me; it’s falling into a state of grayness and numbness.” -Dan Reynolds
“It was against my principles and all, but I was feeling so depressed I didn’t even think. That’s the whole trouble. When you’re feeling very depressed, you can’t even think.” -JD. Salinger

“I cry a lot. My emotions are very close to my surface. I don’t want to hold anything in so it festers and turns into pus – a pustule of emotion that exploded into a festering cesspool of depression.” -Nicolas Cage

Grief counselling is a form of therapeutic intervention designed to help individuals cope with the emotional and psychological pain associated with bereavement. 

It provides an opportunity for people to explore their feelings in a safe and supportive environment, allowing them to express their emotions without fear or judgement. 

Grief counselling can also provide practical strategies for managing difficult thoughts, memories, and behaviours that may be experienced during times of grief. 

Through this process, clients are able to move through the stages of grief at their own pace while gaining insight into how they can best support themselves going forward.

#mindmosaicindia #mentlahealthmatters #qanda #griefcounselling #griefsupport #psychologistindia

Dementia is a collective term for various brain disorders that can cause memory loss, confusion, and behavioral changes. 

Elderly individuals are the most vulnerable to dementia due to their increased risk of stroke and Alzheimer’s, though dementia can strike at any age. If you or someone you know is displaying signs of the disease early detection and diagnosis is key. 

Those who suffer with dementia are often challenged with problems related to memory, language, perception and problem solving.

#dementia #brainfunction #mentalhealth #earlydetection #cognitivefunctions #alzheimersawareness

fields.name: description
fields.value:
🙆Deep breathing benefits

Deep breathing also goes by the names of diaphragmatic breathing, abdominal breathing, belly breathing, and paced respiration. When you breathe deeply, the air coming in through your nose fully fills your lungs, and the lower belly rises.

For many of us, deep breathing seems unnatural. There are several reasons for this. For one, body image has a negative impact on respiration in our culture. A flat stomach is considered attractive, so women (and men) tend to hold in their stomach muscles. This interferes with deep breathing and gradually makes shallow "chest breathing" seem normal, which increases tension and anxiety.

fields.value:
Should you eliminate salt and sugar from the diet?

Salt and sugar play an important role in the smooth functioning of the body. Salt is a mineral, which is required to maintain fluid levels and acid-base balance, conduct nerve impulses, and regulate muscle contractions. On the other hand, sugar is a form of carbohydrate and a good source of energy for our day-to-day activities. However, there is no denying that excess salt and sugar consumption is linked to adverse health outcomes. But, it is all right to add the recommended amount to your diet. People are often unaware of the amount of salt and sugar they consume because they usually do not keep a tab on their consumption of processed foods and preservatives. Salt recommendation for healthy adults by World Health Organization (WHO) is less than five grams (1 teaspoon)/ day. For children, it is between two to 15 years, it is less than for adults and depends on their energy needs. Free sugar intake is recommended at 5-10 per cent of the total calories. Salt can come into the diet from processed foods like ready-to-eat meals, noodles, cheese, salty snacks like chips and mixtures, processed meats like bacon, ham, salami, etc or through preservative-laden foods such as pickles, jam, jelly, sauces etc. Similarly, free sugar can be added to gravies, sodas, shakes, concentrated fruit juices, candies, sugary snacks etc. 

Avoid using table salt shakers at the dining table.
*Watch, read, and analyse food labels before buying the product.
*Limit salty snack consumption.
*Prefer home-cooked meals over ready-to-eat meals.
*Limit processed and preservative-laden foods in your diet.
*Added sugar has no advantage, so avoid adding sugar in beverages and other foods. Rather prefer eating whole fruits to satisfy your sugar craving.
*Avoid refined white sugar and replace it with healthy substitutes like nuts, raisins, figs, munakka, organic jaggery, honey, coconut sugar etc.
*Eat small frequent meals to avoid sugar cravings.

To read my full article click on below link
https://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/health/eliminate-salt-and-sugar-diet-facts-benefits-7927998/lite/

fields.value:
Self Image Reprogramming Tips ❤️


Building a positive self-image is crucial for personal growth and well-being. Here are five tips to help you improve your self-image:

1. Practice self-compassion: Treat yourself with kindness and understanding. Acknowledge your strengths and weaknesses without being overly critical. Remember that everyone makes mistakes, and it's essential to learn from them rather than dwell on them. Treat yourself like you would treat a close friend.

2. Focus on your strengths: Identify your unique talents, skills, and qualities. Celebrate your achievements, no matter how big or small. By focusing on your strengths, you can boost your self-confidence and reinforce a positive self-image. Set goals that align with your strengths and work towards them.

3. Surround yourself with positive influences: Surround yourself with people who uplift and support you. Avoid individuals who constantly bring you down or undermine your self-image. Seek out positive role models who inspire you and encourage your personal growth. Additionally, engage in activities and hobbies that make you feel good about yourself and align with your values.

4. Practice self-care: Take care of your physical and mental well-being. Prioritize activities that promote self-care, such as exercising regularly, eating nutritious food, getting enough sleep, and managing stress effectively. Engaging in self-care activities can boost your self-esteem and create a positive self-image.

5. Challenge negative self-talk: Be aware of negative thoughts or self-critical inner dialogue. Whenever you catch yourself engaging in negative self-talk, challenge those thoughts by replacing them with positive and realistic affirmations. Remind yourself of your strengths, accomplishments, and the progress you have made. Over time, this practice can help rewire your thinking patterns and cultivate a more positive self-image.

Remember, building a positive self-image takes time and consistent effort. Be patient with yourself and practice these tips regularly to gradually improve your self-image and overall well-being.

Thank You

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Meaningful Relationships

Here are some small but impactful tips for fostering healthy relationships:

1. Effective communication: Communication is vital for any relationship. Practice active listening, express your thoughts and feelings openly, and strive for understanding and empathy.

2. Respect and kindness: Treat your partner with respect, kindness, and appreciation. Show gratitude for their efforts and avoid belittling or demeaning them.

3. Quality time together: Make time for each other and engage in activities that strengthen your bond. It could be as simple as having a conversation, going for a walk, or enjoying a shared hobby.

4. Independence and personal space: Encourage each other's individuality and allow for personal space and time alone. It's essential to maintain a healthy balance between togetherness and personal growth.

5. Trust and honesty: Build trust through open and honest communication. Be reliable, keep your promises, and avoid hiding important information or deceiving your partner.

6. Conflict resolution: Disagreements are natural, but how you handle them matters. Practice effective conflict resolution by actively listening, compromising, and seeking solutions that work for both of you.

7. Emotional support: Be there for your partner during both triumphs and challenges. Offer emotional support, lend a listening ear, and validate their feelings.

8. Show affection: Physical affection, such as hugging, holding hands, and kissing, can help maintain a strong connection. Don't forget to express your love and appreciation verbally as well.

9. Share responsibilities: A healthy relationship involves sharing responsibilities and tasks. Contribute equally to household chores, decision-making, and other obligations to maintain balance and fairness.

10. Continuous growth: Encourage personal growth and support each other's goals and aspirations. Celebrate achievements and inspire one another to reach new heights.

Remember that building a healthy relationship takes effort and commitment from both partners. Small gestures and consistent practice of these tips can lead to a more fulfilling and satisfying relationship.

fields.value:
Few Signs of Trauma Release Post Coaching Lessons 

Trauma release refers to the process of releasing or discharging the emotional, physical, and psychological effects of a traumatic experience. While the specific signs of trauma release may vary from person to person, there are some common indicators that suggest progress in this area. Here are a few signs that someone may be experiencing trauma release:

1. Emotional Release: Individuals may exhibit heightened emotions, such as crying, anger, or sadness, as they release pent-up feelings associated with the trauma. They might also experience a sense of relief, lightness, or increased emotional stability after expressing these emotions.

2. Physical Sensations: During trauma release, people might notice physical sensations like trembling, shaking, or shivering. These physiological responses are natural ways for the body to release stored tension and energy related to the traumatic experience.

3. Increased Awareness: As trauma is processed and released, individuals may gain a deeper understanding of their trauma and its impact on their lives. They may become more aware of the thoughts, beliefs, and behaviors that have been influenced by the traumatic experience, which can lead to personal growth and healing.

4. Improved Sleep: Trauma often disrupts sleep patterns, leading to insomnia, nightmares, or restless sleep. When trauma is released, individuals may notice an improvement in their sleep quality, with fewer disruptions and a more restful experience.

5. Reduced Triggers: Trauma can create hypersensitivity to certain triggers, reminders, or situations associated with the traumatic event. As trauma is released, individuals may find that their triggers become less intense or more manageable. They might develop coping strategies to navigate triggering situations with increased ease.

6. Greater Resilience: Trauma release often leads to increased resilience and coping skills. Individuals may find themselves better equipped to deal with stress, adversity, or challenging situations that previously would have triggered them or overwhelmed them.

It's important to note that trauma release is a highly individualized process, and people may experience these signs to varying degrees and in different orders. If you or someone you know is dealing with trauma, it's advisable to seek professional help from a therapist or counselor who specializes in trauma treatment.

Thank You
Lavanya

fields.name: description
fields.value:
55% Of The communication or let me say making sense of others happens through body language and here are few tips to maintain a healthy body language that wins 💪 hearts and interviews ......

Confident body language can play a crucial role in how others perceive you and how you feel about yourself. Here are some tips to help you project confidence through your body language:

1. Posture: Stand tall with your shoulders back and your head held high. Keep your spine straight, as good posture instantly conveys confidence.

2. Eye contact: Maintain steady eye contact when engaging in conversations. It shows that you are present and attentive. However, be mindful not to stare intensely, as that can be intimidating.

3. Smile: A genuine smile can make you appear approachable and confident. It also helps create a positive atmosphere and encourages others to engage with you.

4. Hand gestures: Use purposeful and controlled hand gestures to emphasize your points. Avoid fidgeting or excessive hand movements, as they can indicate nervousness.

5. Walk with purpose: Walk with a confident stride, keeping your head up and your movements deliberate. Avoid shuffling or slouching, as it can convey a lack of confidence.

6. Voice and tone: Speak clearly and confidently. Project your voice and avoid mumbling or speaking too softly. Vary your tone to show enthusiasm and engagement in the conversation.

7. Space awareness: Take up space comfortably without invading others' personal space. Stand or sit with an open posture, using appropriate arm and leg positioning.

8. Avoid fidgeting: Nervous movements such as tapping your fingers, bouncing your leg, or playing with objects can convey anxiety or lack of confidence. Try to be aware of these habits and minimize them.

9. Mirroring: Subtly mirror the body language of the person you are conversing with. This can help establish rapport and create a positive connection.

10. Practice mindfulness: Be aware of your body language and make conscious efforts to adjust it. Practice in front of a mirror or record yourself to observe your nonverbal cues and make improvements.

Remember, confident body language takes practice, so be patient with yourself. With time and conscious effort, you can develop a more confident presence.

Thank You
Lavanya

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Sometimes Only Thing You Can Do is work according to the situation. conflict management is not only important for professionals but also for a homemaker. by staying aware of conflict management skills you will most certainly work towards a win win situation. 

Conflict management is an essential skill in both personal and professional settings. Here are some tips to help you effectively manage conflicts:

1. Remain #calm : Stay composed and avoid getting emotional. Emotions can escalate the conflict and hinder productive resolution.

2. Active #listening : Give your full attention to the other person and listen attentively to their perspective. Show empathy and seek to understand their point of view.

3. Clarify and paraphrase: Summarize what the other person has said to ensure you've understood them correctly. This demonstrates that you value their input and can help prevent misunderstandings.

4. Express yourself clearly: Clearly articulate your thoughts, feelings, and concerns using "I" statements. Avoid blaming or accusing language, as it can escalate the conflict further.

5. Find common ground: Look for areas of agreement or shared interests. Emphasize common goals and values to create a foundation for resolution.

6. Collaborate: Work together to find a mutually acceptable solution. Encourage brainstorming and be open to compromise. Aim for win-win outcomes where both parties feel satisfied.

7. Focus on the issue, not the #person: Avoid personal attacks or making the conflict about individuals. Keep the discussion centered on the problem at hand to maintain a constructive atmosphere.

8. Take a #break if needed: If emotions are running high or the discussion becomes unproductive, it's okay to take a break. Step away and give yourself time to cool down before resuming the conversation.

9. Seek mediation if necessary: In more complex or persistent conflicts, consider involving a neutral third party to mediate and facilitate the resolution process.

10. Learn from the conflict: After the conflict is resolved, reflect on the experience and identify lessons learned. This can help you improve your conflict management skills and prevent similar conflicts in the future.

Remember, conflict is a natural part of human interaction, and managing it effectively can lead to better relationships, increased understanding, and improved outcomes.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Few Tips For Self Hypnosis...... 

Self-hypnosis can be a powerful tool for personal growth, relaxation, and overcoming certain challenges. Here are some tips to help you practice self-hypnosis effectively:

1. Find a quiet and comfortable space: Choose a calm and quiet environment where you won't be interrupted. Find a comfortable chair or lie down in a relaxing position.

2. Set your intention: Determine what you want to achieve through self-hypnosis. Whether it's reducing stress, building confidence, or improving a specific aspect of your life, clarify your goal before starting.

3. Relax your body and mind: Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths. Focus on releasing any tension in your body and clearing your mind of distracting thoughts.

4. Induce a trance-like state: This can be done through various techniques, such as counting down from 10 to 1 and imagining yourself descending a staircase or repeating a relaxation script. The goal is to reach a state of deep relaxation and heightened focus.

5. Visualize and use positive affirmations: Once in a relaxed state, visualize yourself achieving your desired outcome. Use positive affirmations and repeat them to yourself, reinforcing your goals and beliefs.

6. Repeat and practice regularly: Self-hypnosis is most effective with regular practice. Dedicate a specific time each day to engage in self-hypnosis and build it into your routine.

7. Use guided self-hypnosis recordings: If you're new to self-hypnosis or find it challenging to induce a trance-like state on your own, you can utilize guided self-hypnosis recordings. These pre-recorded sessions provide step-by-step instructions and can be a helpful resource.

Remember, self-hypnosis should always be practiced safely and with the goal of self-improvement. If you have any underlying medical or mental health conditions, it's advisable to consult with a qualified professional before incorporating self-hypnosis into your routine.

 #mentalhealth #like #environment #medical #building #help #growth #hypnotherapy #nlppractitioner #cbttherapy #psychology #selflove #selfimage #selfhealing

Limiting beliefs are self-imposed restrictions that hinder personal growth and success. Here are some one-line points about limiting beliefs:

1. Limiting beliefs prevent you from reaching your full potential.

2. They stem from negative thoughts and experiences, shaping your perception of what is possible.

3. Limiting beliefs create mental barriers that hold you back from taking risks or pursuing opportunities.

4. They can manifest as self-doubt, fear of failure, or a fixed mindset.

5. Limiting beliefs limit your ability to adapt, learn, and embrace change.

6. They reinforce a sense of scarcity and block abundance mentality.

7. Overcoming limiting beliefs requires challenging and reframing them with positive and empowering beliefs.

8. Replacing limiting beliefs with empowering ones opens doors to new possibilities and personal growth.

9. Self-awareness is key to identifying and addressing limiting beliefs.

10. Letting go of limiting beliefs allows you to unlock your true potential and live a more fulfilling life.

As Within So Without! You Can only give something that you have. start with building a meaningful connection with your subconscious mind 

 Here are some strategies for building rapport with your subconscious mind:

1. Positive Affirmations: Use positive affirmations regularly to program your subconscious mind with empowering beliefs. Repeat affirmations related to your goals, aspirations, and self-worth. By consistently reinforcing positive thoughts, you establish a rapport with your subconscious, which can facilitate its alignment with your conscious desires.

2. Visualization: Practice visualization exercises to vividly imagine yourself achieving your desired outcomes. Visualize the details, emotions, and sensations associated with your goals. This technique communicates your intentions and desires to your subconscious mind in a way that it understands and responds to.

3. Meditation: Engage in regular meditation to quiet the conscious mind and create a receptive state for your subconscious. During meditation, you can focus on positive intentions, gratitude, or self-reflection. By calming your thoughts and entering a relaxed state, you enhance your connection with the subconscious mind.

4. Creative Expression: Engage in creative activities that speak to your subconscious mind, such as drawing, painting, writing, or playing music. These activities tap into your intuitive and imaginative faculties, allowing you to communicate with your subconscious on a deeper level.

5. Journaling: Keep a journal to explore your thoughts, feelings, and experiences. This practice helps you gain insights into your subconscious patterns, desires, and challenges. By writing down your thoughts and reflections, you establish a channel of communication with your subconscious.

6. Trust and Intuition: Learn to trust your intuition and listen to your inner guidance. Your subconscious mind often communicates through intuition, gut feelings, and hunches. Pay attention to these signals and allow yourself to follow them when they align with your goals and values.

7. Emotional Healing: Address any unresolved emotional issues or traumas that may be stored in your subconscious mind. Engaging in therapy, self-reflection, or other healing modalities can help you release negative emotions and establish a healthier relationship with your subconscious.

Remember, building #rapport with your subconscious mind is an ongoing process that requires patience, consistency, and self-awareness. 
.
.
.
Lavanya

fields.value:
A Personal #experience ... So As You know I have coached 100s of clients....one on one This one client a young 🌱 girl of 25 called me ... she was perplexed 😕 as despite the fact she had knowledge she couldn't clear any interview and it was her day #4th  of #campus  interview...... we had 2 days to practice...... and I gave her a simple technique which you may not believe.... I asked her if confidence had a #colour  what colour 🌈 would that be she said blue 🔵 I taught he a technique to install that into her subconscious mind.... guess what ? she cleared...... the interview. this may sound silly but at times knowledge isn't enough! you have to walk that extra mile.... do read her review 

1. #posture : Sit or stand tall with your shoulders back and your head held high. Good posture demonstrates poise and self-assurance.

2. #eye  contact: Establish and maintain eye contact with the interviewer(s) throughout the conversation. This demonstrates engagement and confidence. However, remember to maintain a natural balance and avoid staring excessively.

3. #handshake : When greeting the interviewer(s), offer a firm handshake while maintaining eye contact. A firm handshake conveys confidence and professionalism.

4. #smile  when appropriate, such as during introductions and when expressing enthusiasm. However, avoid constant or forced smiling, as it may come across as insincere.

5. Use open gestures: Use open and relaxed gestures to appear approachable and confident. Keep your arms uncrossed and avoid fidgeting or playing with objects. Allow your hands to rest comfortably on the table or use them to emphasize key points in a natural manner.

6. Lean slightly forward: Leaning slightly forward demonstrates engagement and interest in the conversation. However, be mindful of personal space boundaries and avoid leaning in excessively.

7. Avoid fidgeting: Minimize fidgeting behaviors like tapping your feet, shaking your leg, or playing with your hair. These actions can convey nervousness or lack of confidence.

8. Moderate your pace: Speak at a moderate pace to convey confidence and thoughtfulness. Speaking too quickly may indicate anxiety, while speaking too slowly may come across as lacking enthusiasm.

9. Mirror the interviewer's body language: Subtly mirroring the interviewer's body language can create a sense of rapport and connection. However, be mindful not to mimic them overtly or excessively.

10. Practice active listening: Demonstrate active listening by nodding, maintaining an engaged expression, and responding appropriately to the interviewer's questions or statements. This shows that you value their input and are fully present in the conversation.


 #interview #help #engagement #language #humanbehavior

fields.value:
As a #motivational #coach, there are several movies that can inspire and provide valuable lessons. Here are five movies that every motivational coach should consider watching:

1. "The Pursuit of #Happyness" (2006): Based on a true story, this film follows the journey of Chris Gardner, a struggling salesman who becomes homeless while trying to provide a better life for his son. It emphasizes the importance of perseverance, resilience, and maintaining a positive mindset even in the face of adversity.

2. "#Rocky" (1976): This iconic film showcases the story of Rocky Balboa, an underdog boxer who gets a shot at the heavyweight title. It teaches the value of hard work, determination, and believing in oneself despite overwhelming odds. The movie's theme of "going the distance" resonates with motivational coaching.

3. "The #Shawshank Redemption" (1994): Set in a prison, this movie portrays the story of Andy Dufresne, who maintains hope, resilience, and inner strength throughout his wrongful imprisonment. It explores themes of redemption, resilience, and the power of the human spirit, offering valuable insights into personal growth and transformation.

4. "#Dead Poets Society" (1989): This film takes place at a conservative boarding school and focuses on an English teacher, John Keating, who inspires his students to seize the day and follow their passions. It encourages viewers to break free from societal expectations, pursue their dreams, and embrace creativity and individuality.

5. "Remember the #Titans" (2000): Based on a true story, this film tells the story of a high school football team during a time of racial integration. It emphasizes teamwork, leadership, and overcoming prejudice. It showcases the power of unity, compassion, and the ability to inspire positive change.

 #mindset 
Remember Teaching Through Stories Is A Powerful Tool 🔥

  #hrcareers 
 #coaching #change #power

Dr. Masaru Emoto's work focused on the effects of thoughts and emotions on water molecules. To incorporate his principles into water manifestation:

1🔥 Positive intentions: Set clear and positive intentions for the water you interact with. Use words and thoughts that promote love, healing, gratitude, and abundance.

2🔥Visualization: Visualize the water you're working with as being pure, vibrant, and filled with positive energy. Imagine it flowing harmoniously and radiating healing energy.

3. 🔥Words and symbols: Write positive words or affix symbols on containers holding water. Use words like "love," "gratitude," or "healing." Symbols such as hearts or sacred geometries can also be used.

4. 🔥Emotions and gratitude: As you interact with water, express gratitude and genuine positive emotions towards it. Feel appreciation and love, knowing that your intentions are being transferred to the water.

5. 🔥🛜Conscious consumption: Consume the water with mindfulness, focusing on the positive intentions you've infused into it. Believe that it will nourish and energize your body and soul.

When Krishna went to Hastinapur and attempted to create a truce between the warring Princes, Duryondhan’s response was very interesting. He did not ask Krishna for advice, rather expressed his inability to control himself. He said he is aware of what is the right thing to do but somehow he cannot stop doing the wrong thing. 

On the other hand, Arjuna also had the same problem - he was unable to control himself. But, there was one major difference between Arjuna and Duryodhan - instead of saying that he is unable to control himself, he lamented about his weakness and asked Krishna for a way out. 

Merely admitting that there is a problem is not sufficient to solve the problem. We need to know and question the problem to find a solution.

As a woman in midlife (from 40 to 65 years of age), you may have experienced a whole lot of ups and your fair share of downs in a pretty eventful life. You’re wise, strong and resilient and have a whole lot of life ahead of you.

So why do you sometimes, even often, feel a bit flat, a bit disheartened, disoriented?
Why is it hard to find the energy and the enthusiasm that used to be such a key part of who you are?
Why does it feel like you’ve lost your purpose, your way in the world?

You’re in the midst of significant change, physically and emotionally as you deal with the midlife crisis, menopause, empty nest syndrome, relationship and body image issues.

Midlife can be a doorway into our most satisfying stage of life. Once we make the decision to embrace it, we can find that elusive 'more' to life.

I'm Arti Keyal, Counselling Psychologist with personal and professional experience of dealing with midlife issues and I'm passionate about helping women bust the midlife myths about what’s possible and navigate this new phase, so you can really thrive, not just survive.

My role is to challenge and support you while giving you the space to explore the myriad possibilities available to you.

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Self-regulating our nervous system is important for our overall well-being and functioning.

 The nervous system is responsible for regulating our physiological and emotional responses to stress and various stimuli. 

When we are able to self-regulate, we can effectively manage our stress levels, promote relaxation, and maintain stable emotional states.

 This helps to prevent the negative effects of chronic stress, such as increased risk of physical and mental health problems.

 Self-regulation allows us to respond to challenges and demands in a more adaptive and controlled manner.

 It enhances our ability to think clearly, make rational decisions, and problem-solve effectively.

 Moreover, self-regulation promotes a sense of empowerment, autonomy, and self-control, improving our overall quality of life and contributing to our emotional well-being. 

By practicing self-regulation techniques, such as deep breathing, mindfulness, and healthy coping strategies, we can create balance and harmony in our nervous system, enhancing our resilience and promoting optimal functioning.

Here I go...

 I am a certified expressive arts therapist (based on integral yoga psychology) and yoga instructor. I am a naturecure practitioner (with my medical background), it allows me to understand nutritional imbalance that cause mental illness.

 Do connect to address your physical issues(Hypertension, Diabetes, PCOS, Chronic illness and Metabolic health issues) and Mental health holistically!

I believe in making a person self reliant in their health and happiness. One should not seek health because they are scared of illness. One should heal because they deeply care about themselves.
